snippet: The judge suggested that a trial would examine a central legal question surrounding the issue: whether the rationales for a ban on same-sex marriage serve a legitimate state interest.
abstract: Federal judge rules that a case contesting Michigan's ban on same-sex marriage will go to trial early in 2014, one among some 30 such challenges playing out in courthouses around the nation.
lead_paragraph: The judge suggested that a trial would examine a central legal question surrounding the issue: whether the rationales for a ban on same-sex marriage serve a legitimate state interest.

headline.main: Case Against Michigan Ban on Gay Unions Is Sent to Trial
headline.print_headline: Case Against Michigan Ban On Gay Unions Is Sent to Trial

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
